title: Castello di Bolgheri 2015  Bolgheri Superiore
description: Inviting aromas of black-skinned berry, underbrush and a whiff of ginger lead the nose on this savory blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Merlot. The structured, juicy palate offers ripe black currant, licorice and black pepper alongside polished tannins. Enjoy through 2024.

title: Chacewater 2014 Astel Petite Sirah (Red Hills Lake County)
description: Sweet and spicy sensations complement the deep dark-berry and chocolate flavors of this full-bodied, dry and firmly mouth-gripping wine. Deep and dark describes the color, too, while the texture is drenched with fine-grained tannins that will add to the wine's longevity. Best after 2020.

title: Château Bellegrave du Poujeau 2015  Haut-Médoc
description: Densely tannic and full of rich blackberry and black-plum flavors, this is a structured wine. It already balances the fruit and the dry core of tannins, indicating a wine of great potential and richness. Drink from 2022.

title: Château Cap Léon Veyrin 2015  Listrac-Médoc
description: Continuing the sequence of fine vintages from this estate, this wine is rich, dense and structured. It has plenty of tannins as well as generous black-plum and spice flavors. Wood aging added light toastiness and is smoothing out the fruit. Drink from 2025.

title: Château Clos Junet 2015  Saint-Émilion
description: This seven-acre property is located to the west of the city of Saint-Émilion on the chalk plateau. This gives the texture to the wine and also the good exposure has added to its richness. Structured with solid tannins and rich with black damson fruits, the wine is ready to age. Drink from 2023.

title: Château Corconnac 2015  Haut-Médoc
description: This soft, ripe wine has smoky wood flavors in the background to add to the richness. Well textured, it is full of blackberries and crisp acidity. The wine, from a 21-acre estate, is dominated by Cabernet Sauvignon giving a structured character. Drink from 2023.

title: Château Haut-Piquat 2015 La Fleur de Château Haut-Piquat  (Lussac Saint-Émilion)
description: Plenty of attention seems to have been lavished on this wine produced from the best parcels on the estate. It offers dense tannins, new-wood mint flavors and an edge of extraction in the bitter-chocolate flavors. With time this will be a rich wine, but one balanced and based around fruit and tannins. Drink from 2023.

title: Alheit 2015 Cartology White (Western Cape)
description: This Chenin Blanc-based wine, with 14% Sémillon, is complex, layered and evolving, expressing different waves of flavor and texture with each sip. Initial scents of lanolin and waxy pink apple transition into earthy notes of dried yellow flowers and grass, while the medium-weight palate evokes tart, refreshing flavors of lime leaf, lemon peel and white melon rind. It's zippy and bright in feel, with lively, briny acidity, and the finish shows fantastic evolution that ends on a earthy, forest-foliage note. Drink now–2025.

title: August Kesseler 2015 N Pinot Noir (Pfalz)
description: Violets and black cherries perfume this lavish, intensely fruity Pinot Noir. Concentrated in lush black plum and berry flavors, it's a full-bodied and fleshy wine but fringed by soft tannins and a long granite finish. Drink now through 2030.

title: Château Vieux Coutelin 2015  Saint-Estèphe
description: This is a richly structured wine from a 24-acre vineyard. With dense tannins and black-currant fruit from the 56% of Cabernet Sauvignon in the blend, the wine is firm at this stage although with a good future. Ripe and concentrated, it will be ready from 2025.

title: Château Vieux Moulin 2015  Listrac-Médoc
description: Four generations of the same family have run this 26-acre vineyard that is mainly planted with Merlot. This ripe, juicy wine is rich in tannins, wood-aging flavors and bold black fruits. Age the wine so that the dry tannins can soften, and drink from 2025.

title: Caven 2011 Messere  (Sforzato di Valtellina)
description: Aromas of baked plum, underbrush and balsamic notes lead the nose. The firm palate offers dried black cherry, tobacco and licorice, with fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2025.

title: Efeste 2014 Taylor Mag Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)
description: This is the winery's first release off its Taylor Mag Vineyard. Aromas don't reveal their charms on first pour, with notes of café au lait, cherry, raspberry, woodspice and herb. The palate brings firm, brawny tannins along with plentiful cherry flavors. Cocoa notes linger on the finish. It's everything you expect from a Cabernet, at a price below many wines from this appellation.

title: Firesteed 2015 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This winery is under new ownership and off to a good start with this widely available, succulent and flat-out delicious Pinot. Spicy cranberry, raspberry and cherry flavors fill out a big midpalate. It boasts tannins that are ripe, supple and proportionate. This lovely wine should be enjoyed over the next couple of years.

title: Fratelli Berlucchi 2013 Freccianera Satèn  (Franciacorta)
description: Here's a vibrant sparkler with delicate but alluring scents of white stone fruit, citrus blossom, hay and bread dough. The elegantly sparkling palate presents golden apple, lemon zest, toasted almond and dried mountain herb set against bright acidity.

title: Helioterra 2016 Pinot Blanc (Willamette Valley)
description: The best of an outstanding white wine lineup, this enters the palate with the clarity of a mountain lake. The clean and crisp fruit flavors of melon and white peach gently pull in accents of butter and caramel, without any single component dominating. It's very fine winemaking.

title: Hugel 2015 Classic Pinot Noir (Alsace)
description: A fleshy hint of ripe cherry creates an inviting nose. The palate is similarly fruity but also firm with fine tannins. There is something rustic, rugged and earthy about this, but in a very engaging way. Slightly rustic but quite alluring. Drink 2018–2025.

title: Il Macchione 2013  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano
description: Camphor, sandalwood, new leather and a whiff of wild berry aromas lead the way. The bright palate mirrors the nose, offering red cherry, pomegranate and star anise framed in fresh acidity and taut polished tannins.

title: Kuentz-Bas 2014 Trois Châteaux Pinot Noir (Alsace)
description: Telltale cinnamon and vanilla headiness hints at new some oak on the nose. The palate offers red cherry flavors that are juicy enough to counterbalance the oak. For now, fine tannins coat the mouth but give structure for fruit and oak to express their well-matched tones. A modern take on Alsace Pinot but with ample freshness.

title: Kuentz-Bas 2016 Trois Châteaux Muscat Ottonel (Alsace)
description: The honeysuckle scent on the nose has an alluring edge of candied lemon peel. The palate, despite being slender and fresh, shows a similarly decadent streak. This lovely fruitiness is joined by more orange peel freshness and a concentrated texture. This is joyous and rich, with a dry, enduring finish.

title: Lorenzi Estate 2013 Alpha Red (Temecula Valley)
description: There's a telltale licorice-like spice that comes from many Temecula Valley wines, and this blend, which throws Syrah in with four Bordeaux varieties, offers a hint of that, but in a well-measured way. Add to that candied blueberry fruit and baking spice on the nose, and black currant, gingerbread and polished tannins on the palate, and this is a winning wine.

title: Lunadoro 2014 Pagliareto  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)
description: This offers classic Sangiovese aromas of wild cherry, tilled soil, blue flower, pipe tobacco and a whiff of truffle. The aromas flow over seamlessly to the polished palate along with a hint of licorice. Reflecting the cool, wet vintage, it's more delicately structured than usual but is a fantastic effort. Drink through 2020.

title: Marqués de Cáceres 2010 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Almost overripe aromas of prune and raisin are at the fore on the nose. A full, chewy palate shows big tannins and roasted, earthy flavors of olive, spice cake and berry fruits. Assertive tannins linger through the finish, with flavors of licorice, herbs and chocolate. Drink through 2022.

title: MonksGate 2015 Classic Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: Classic is a pretty good description of this wine. It's meaty, firm, muscular and loaded with ripe blackberry and black-cherry fruit. The ripe ample tannins support that compact strength, and it has the balance and structure to cellar for the next decade. Drink 2020–2030.

title: Parras Wines 2015 Quinta do Gradil Reserva Red (Lisboa)
description: This dense wine has great tannins as well as rich fruit. Juicy crispness gives the wine balance and aging potential. Wood aging for eight months has smoothed the wine and given it extra richness. Drink from 2019.

title: Phelps Creek 2015 Cuvée Alexandrine Pinot Noir (Columbia Gorge (OR))
description: Once again this cuvée expresses exceptional elegance and finesse. There's a floral top note that leads into a quite pretty palate, with plum, cherry and a touch of cocoa. Drink now through the mid-2020s.

title: Plozza 2013 BlackEdition Sforzato Riserva  (Valtellina Superiore)
description: Aromas of fig, chopped mint and tobacco follow over to the structured full-bodied palate along with steeped prune, cranberry and licorice. Tightly woven fine-grained tannins provide the framework while fresh acidity brightens the rich flavors. Drink 2023–2033.

title: Plungerhead 2015 Petite Sirah (Lodi)
description: This very full-bodied wine is a great deal for $14. It tastes smoky and spicy, weaving herbaceous, savory nuances with meaty ones while a rich and relatively gentle texture coats the palate and holds onto the charred, beefy flavors on the finish.

title: Ponzi 2015 Abetina Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)
description: A smooth entry is focused on red and blue berries and plums, with a whiff of sweet tobacco and a vein of chocolate. There's a stiff edge to the tannins, and overall this seems a bit lighter, less concentrated, than in past vintages.

title: Powicana Farm 2015 Petite Sirah (Redwood Valley)
description: A distinctive blueberry aroma and flavor joins with spicy black pepper in this vivid and fascinating but not overly heavy wine made without added sulfites. It's about as elegant as Petite Sirah gets. An almost silky texture emerges despite firm tannins and there's a sense of focus from the first whiff through the lingering finish.
